snippet: Some restaurateurs say that the letter grades, which must be displayed in a prominent position, are handed out in unfair and inconsistent ways.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg publicly defends Health and Hygiene Department's restaurant inspection program in light of criticism from some restaurant owners who say grading system is inconsistent and unfair; Bloomberg says that grades provide city diners with more access to information about an establishment and cautions that an imperfect rating is not necessarily a reason to avoid a restaurant.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: Some restaurateurs say that the letter grades, which must be displayed in a prominent position, are handed out in unfair and inconsistent ways.

headline.seo: Restaurant Grading System, Under Fire, Gets Mayor’s Backing
headline.main: Bloomberg Defends Grading System Derided by Restaurateurs
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Defends Grading System Derided by Restaurateurs
